definitions: piece or section removed from something larger
decorative shape cut from paper or other material
automatic switch that stops electrical flow when overloaded
examples: The magazine included colorful cutouts for children to assemble
She carefully removed the cutout from the cardboard sheet
The window display featured festive holiday cutouts of snowflakes
Paper cutouts decorated the entire classroom for the celebration
The motor's thermal cutout prevented it from overheating yesterday
An electrical cutout protected the circuit from damage

definitions: tool or machine designed for cutting various materials
small single-masted sailing vessel used for patrol or racing
person whose profession involves cutting materials or making cuts
examples: The diamond cutter requires steady hands and precision tools
She used a paper cutter to trim the documents
The coast guard cutter patrolled the harbor all night
A racing cutter sailed past the lighthouse yesterday
The film cutter worked late editing the documentary footage
The gem cutter examined the stone under magnification

definitions: person who acts ruthlessly or without moral restraint
straight razor with a folding blade used for shaving
North American trout species with red markings under its jaw
examples: The business world attracted many cutthroats seeking quick profits
He had a reputation as a cutthroat in negotiations
The barber sharpened his antique cutthroat before each shave
Vintage cutthroats have become valuable collector's items recently
They caught several cutthroat trout in the mountain stream
The cutthroat is Montana's official state fish

definitions: piece of plant removed for propagation or cultivation purposes
action or process of dividing something with a sharp instrument
remark or comment intended to hurt someone's feelings emotionally
examples: She planted rose cuttings in small pots with rooting hormone
The gardener took several cuttings from the mature plant
The cutting of the ribbon marked the grand opening ceremony
Diamond cutting requires years of training and experience
His cutting remarks about her appearance upset everyone present
She responded with an equally cutting comment about his work

definitions: marine mollusk with tentacles and internal shell that produces ink
examples: The cuttlefish changed colors to blend with the coral reef
Divers photographed a giant cuttlefish near the Australian coast

definitions: greenish-blue color used as primary color in printing processes
examples: The printer ran out of cyan ink during the large print job
She chose cyan for the ocean in her digital artwork

definitions: highly poisonous chemical compound containing carbon and nitrogen atoms
examples: The detective found traces of cyanide in the victim's blood
Industrial processes using cyanide require strict safety protocols

definitions: criminal activities carried out using computers or the internet
examples: The FBI's cybercrime division investigated the ransomware attack
Small businesses often lack adequate protection against cybercrime

definitions: science fiction genre featuring advanced technology and societal breakdown
person associated with cyberpunk culture or aesthetic
examples: William Gibson's novels defined the cyberpunk genre in literature
The movie showcased classic cyberpunk themes of corporate dystopia
The cyberpunk dressed in black leather and neon accessories
Local cyberpunks gathered at the underground technology convention

definitions: virtual environment of computer networks where online communication occurs
examples: Millions of users interact daily in cyberspace through social media
The company established a strong presence in cyberspace

definitions: being with both organic and biomechatronic body parts integrated together
examples: The science fiction novel featured a cyborg protagonist with enhanced abilities
Medical advances bring us closer to creating real cyborgs

definitions: series of events that repeat in a regular pattern
vehicle with two wheels powered by pedaling
single complete execution of a periodically repeated phenomenon
examples: The water cycle involves evaporation, condensation, and precipitation continuously
Economic cycles of growth and recession affect global markets
She rode her cycle to work every morning through the park
The shop repairs all types of cycles and scooters
The washing machine completed its spin cycle after thirty minutes
Each cycle of the engine produces power through four strokes

definitions: sport or activity of riding bicycles for recreation or competition
examples: Professional cycling requires intense training and endurance building
She took up cycling to improve her cardiovascular health

definitions: person who rides a bicycle especially regularly or professionally
examples: The cyclist wore a helmet and reflective gear for safety
Professional cyclists train for hours every day

definitions: large-scale rotating storm system with strong winds around low-pressure center
examples: The cyclone devastated coastal communities with winds exceeding 150 mph
Meteorologists tracked the cyclone's path across the Indian Ocean

definitions: young swan typically with gray or brown feathers before maturity
examples: The mother swan protected her cygnets from predators
Five cygnets followed their parents across the lake

definitions: three-dimensional geometric figure with circular parallel ends
chamber in engine where piston moves to generate power
container or object with cylindrical shape for storage
examples: Students calculated the volume of a cylinder in math class
The sculpture featured a perfect cylinder of polished marble
The mechanic replaced a damaged cylinder in the car engine
This motorcycle has a powerful four-cylinder engine
The oxygen cylinder supplied air to the deep-sea diver
She stored the posters in a protective cardboard cylinder

definitions: circular brass plate that produces sound when struck or crashed together
examples: The drummer crashed the cymbals during the song's climax
She practiced playing the cymbals in the school orchestra

definitions: person who believes people are motivated purely by self-interest
examples: The old cynic dismissed all acts of charity as self-serving
Even cynics were moved by the genuine display of kindness

definitions: attitude of scornful distrust of human nature and motives
examples: Years of disappointment had fostered deep cynicism about politics
His cynicism prevented him from trusting anyone's good intentions

definitions: system of secret writing using substitution or transposition of letters
mathematical symbol representing zero or nothing
person of no importance or influence in a situation
examples: Intelligence officers worked to break the enemy's complex cypher
The ancient manuscript was written in an undeciphered cypher
The accountant wrote a cypher to indicate no value
In binary code, ones and cyphers represent all information
He felt like a mere cypher in the corporate hierarchy
The new employee was treated as a cypher by management

definitions: closed sac-like structure containing fluid or semi-solid material in body tissue
examples: The doctor removed a benign cyst from her shoulder
An ultrasound revealed a small cyst on the patient's kidney

definitions: gel-like substance within cell membrane surrounding nucleus containing organelles
examples: Nutrients move through the cytoplasm to reach different organelles
The microscope clearly showed cytoplasm surrounding the cell nucleus

definitions: emperor of Russia before the 1917 revolution
person appointed to oversee and coordinate a particular area
examples: Czar Nicholas II was the last emperor of Russia
The czar ruled the Russian Empire with absolute power
The president appointed a drug czar to combat narcotics trafficking
She served as the company's marketing czar for five years

definitions: small quantity of something soft or moist applied to surface
small flatfish found in North Atlantic coastal waters
quick light touch or application of something
examples: She applied a dab of perfume behind each ear
Add just a dab of butter to the heated pan
The fisherman caught several dabs off the pier yesterday
Dabs are popular eating fish in European coastal towns
He gave the wound a gentle dab with antiseptic solution
The artist added dabs of color to highlight the painting

definitions: informal term for one's father or male parent
examples: My dad taught me how to ride a bicycle
The kids ran to greet their dad after work

definitions: early 20th-century art movement rejecting logic and embracing chaos and irrationality
examples: Marcel Duchamp was a prominent figure in the dada movement
Dada art challenged traditional aesthetic values through absurdist works

definitions: informal or childish term for father used especially by children
examples: The toddler called for her daddy when she got scared
Daddy promised to take us to the park tomorrow

definitions: computer program that runs as background process without user interaction
supernatural being in ancient Greek belief between gods and humans
examples: The system daemon manages network connections automatically
Email daemons handle message delivery in the background
Ancient Greeks believed daemons influenced human fate and fortune
The philosopher wrote about daemons as divine intermediaries

definitions: yellow or white spring flower with trumpet-shaped center from bulb plant
examples: Golden daffodils bloomed throughout the garden in early spring
She planted daffodil bulbs along the walkway last autumn

definitions: short knife with pointed blade used as stabbing weapon
typographic symbol (â€ ) used for footnotes or references
examples: The museum displayed an ornate ceremonial dagger from ancient Egypt
He wore a decorative dagger on his belt at the Renaissance fair
The editor marked the disputed passage with a dagger symbol
Use a dagger to indicate the second footnote reference

definitions: South Asian dish made from split pulses cooked with spices
examples: She prepared yellow dahl with turmeric and cumin for dinner
The restaurant serves various types of dahl with naan bread

definitions: bushy tuberous plant with showy colorful flowers native to Mexico
examples: The dahlia exhibition featured hundreds of varieties in full bloom
She won first prize for her giant dinner-plate dahlias

definitions: something delicate, pretty, or elegant in appearance or construction
small choice piece of food considered particularly delicious
examples: The antique shop displayed various dainties from the Victorian era
She admired the lace dainties in the vintage clothing store
The tea party featured cucumber sandwiches and other dainties
Guests sampled various dainties at the reception buffet

definitions: farm or building where milk is processed and milk products are made
food products made from milk including cheese, butter, and yogurt
examples: The local dairy delivers fresh milk every morning to subscribers
They toured a working dairy to see cheese-making processes
She avoided all dairy due to lactose intolerance issues
The grocery store's dairy section offers organic options

definitions: business of producing, processing, and distributing milk and milk products
examples: Modern dairying requires significant investment in equipment and technology
The region's economy depends heavily on dairying and agriculture

definitions: small white flower with yellow center growing in lawns and meadows
examples: Children made daisy chains in the meadow during summer
Wild daisies covered the hillside in a blanket of white

definitions: variant spelling of dahl, split pulse dish from South Asia
examples: The menu featured red dal cooked with aromatic spices
She served dal and rice as a nutritious vegetarian meal

definitions: broad valley especially in northern England or Scotland countryside
examples: Sheep grazed peacefully in the Yorkshire dales during spring
The hiking trail wound through several scenic dales

definitions: large dog breed with distinctive black or brown spots on white coat
examples: The fire station's dalmatian mascot rode on the truck
Their dalmatian required daily exercise and regular grooming

definitions: barrier built across water to control flow or create reservoir
female parent of four-legged domestic animal especially horses
examples: The hydroelectric dam generated power for three surrounding states
Beavers built a dam across the stream using branches
The foal's dam was a prize-winning thoroughbred mare
This puppy's dam has an excellent temperament and pedigree

definitions: physical harm that impairs value, usefulness, or normal function
money claimed or awarded as compensation for loss or injury
examples: The storm caused extensive damage to coastal properties
Technicians assessed the damage to the computer system
The jury awarded significant damages for the plaintiff's injuries
She sued for damages after the breach of contract

definitions: reversible figured fabric with woven patterns typically used for table linens
examples: The dining room featured elegant damask tablecloths and napkins
She chose ivory damask curtains for the formal living room

definitions: title given to woman equivalent to knight in British honors
informal or old-fashioned term for an elderly woman
examples: Dame Judi Dench received her title for services to drama
The ceremony honored several new dames and knights
The old dame lived alone in the cottage by the woods
Local dames gathered for their weekly bridge game

definitions: mild profanity expressing anger, frustration, or emphasis
state of being condemned especially to eternal punishment
examples: He muttered a damn when he dropped his phone
I don't give a damn about their opinion
The preacher warned about the damn of eternal souls
Medieval texts described the damn awaiting sinners

definitions: condemnation to eternal punishment in hell according to religious belief
examples: The sermon focused on salvation versus damnation of souls
Medieval art often depicted scenes of damnation and redemption

definitions: those condemned to eternal punishment in religious belief
examples: Dante's Inferno describes the fate of the damned in hell
The painting showed the damned descending into eternal fire

definitions: slight wetness or moisture in air, surfaces, or materials
examples: The basement walls showed signs of rising damp
Morning damp made the grass slippery underfoot

definitions: act of making something less strong, active, or intense
examples: The dampening of enthusiasm was noticeable after the setback
Sound dampening materials were installed in the recording studio

definitions: device that reduces vibration, sound, or controls air flow
something that makes feelings or atmosphere less enthusiastic
examples: The piano's damper pedal sustained the notes beautifully
Adjust the chimney damper to control the fire
Rain put a damper on the outdoor wedding celebration
His negative comments were a damper on everyone's mood
